channel.title: Immigration on TalkAboutBrex
channel.description: Recent content in Immigration on TalkAboutBrex

item.title: Immigrants give more than they take
item.description: On average, migrants from the EU contribute around Â£2,300 more to the UK than they take.

item.title: UK Nationals may have to leave the EU
item.description: If the UK leaves the EU, people from the UK will lose the automatic right to live, work and retire there. 1.2 million people from UK currently live in the EU. What will happen to them?

item.title: We can control immigration from EU
item.description: EU law states that people from the EU must either have a job or enough money to not be a burden on the UK’s public services and have medical insurance to be allowed to come and live here.

item.title: We control immigration from outside EU
item.description: As members of the EU, we are in complete control of immigration from countries outside the EU. We control immigration to the UK from 169 countries of the world.

item.title: We need EU people to work in NHS
item.description: 62,000 people from the EU currently work in the NHS. But the NHS is still short of 35,000 nurses and nearly 10,000 doctors. What would we do without the doctors and nurses from the EU?
